title: UI of PiP media control buttons are off-center in latest 110.0.0 version
content:
From within 'about:config' I have the pref value of 'media.videocontrols.picture-in-picture.improved-video-controls.enabled' set to true, but ever since updating Firefox itself from the 109 version to the 110.0.0 version - the UI of the media controls in PiP mode appear to be off-center.

Previous to updating to the 110.0.0 version - the UI of the media control buttons in PiP mode were shifted more to the left which made the UI of the media control buttons look neater and cleaner.

So the time code section showing you how much of the video you have currently watched and also how long the duration of the video actually is, was displayed further to the left side of the floating window screen, and the other media controls like the 'back to tab button', the 'backward seek button', the 'play button', the 'forward seek button', the 'mute button', and the 'fullscreen button' were also placed and spaced more to the left side of the floating window screen as well.

Attached is a picture of what the UI of the media controls in PiP now looks like in the latest 110.0.0 version.

Does it look 'off-center' like this for anyone else too?
creator: thethingking91

title: Won't save logins
content: This version of Firefox, 110 will not save logins or ask if I want to save them. I have logged into Google and Mozilla but they are not saved. I also have that "Your browser is being managed by your organization." again. I'm running Windows 11 Pro 22H2 on my Dell Inspiron 5759 laptop. I'm not sure what else to provide for details. I actually have two of the laptops and they both will not save logins in Firefox 110. I changed the policy for Firefox in Regedit but that didn't help getting rid of the GPO notice. Both of these computers are for personal use only. I don't know if there is a conflict between Firefox 110 and Windows 11 Pro. I have used Firefox for many, many years with few issues. I don't like Chrome but I guess I'll try it.
creator: leoman1
